name: Orbello
description:
This is a pet project of mine.

While I have made it entirely for my own enjoyment I'm happy to hear any feedback/suggestions you might have about it.

You have full six axis control (thrust, strafe, lift, pitch, roll, yaw) as well as zero drag. The default controls are visible at the pause menu (escape).

Utilise each object's gravity in order to scan the planets or the star efficiently.

Left-click to select target. Right-click to zoom. Planets that are far away will be marked by a circle with a line pointing to system north. The planets don't move but are spawned in random locations around their orbits at the start of each game.

Pressing 'M' brings up a map of the system.  ASWD controls the camera (left Shift for fast movement), mouse-scroll zooms in and out.  Left-click selects/deselects objects.

There is a Tips screen accessible from the title screen and from the pause menu.

We recommend using the highest resolution setting so everything is spaced correctly. It's a pretty low-demand game so it should still run smoothly.

This game can be very difficult to get to grips with, so any and all questions are welcome. =)
